communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023 through current:

1) Copies of all invoices from the Jarecki Law Group;

2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Jarecki Law Group. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.

3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Jarecki Law Group, including any modifications or changes.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that show all initial and follow up incident reporting information pertaining to the incident that took place on Friday morning, March 1, 2024 on and near highway 270 northbound lanes, just before the highway 70 interchange between the hours of 8am and 10am.

Copies of all records that show additional vehicle incidents that occurred on highway 270 between the interchanges of highways 44 and highway 70 that took place during the same hours. Please include documents that show details of vehicles make and model, that identify all local, state and federal law enforcement and safety agencies that collaborated in response to the incidents and that indicate whether there were any injuries or fatalities.

I am also requesting all traffic and safety camera footage from the same section of highway along 270 between the interchanges of highway 44 and West Florissant Ave for the same timeframe of 8am to 10am

I request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically or by CD-ROM if necessary.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Personnel Files, Principals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Leonard Harris, current principal at Nancy B Jefferson High School
*Sharnette Sims, current principal at York High School
*Joenile Albert-Reese, current principal at Pritzker Elementary
*Heidy Moran, current principal at Schurz High School

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Restriction Letters, Options
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show copies of Parent Restriction letters issued from July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2023 for the following schools/instances:

1. Any letters issued by schools in the Options Network:

Jefferson High School
York High School
Simpson High School


These may also be listed as "Violation of Visitor Protocol" letters. Please note that I am not seeking any personally identifiable information or otherwise exempt information. As required by the statute, please ensure that the requested documents are redacted rather than exempting the entirety of the document. Additionally, for any and all exemptions used to redact exempt information, please provide clear and convincing evidence for each exemption used by your agency.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All meeting minutes, monthly progress reports, draft reports, slide decks, and other work products related to the work performed under Contracts #151553 and 151533-1 regarding RNG potential in New York State. 

Please limit the search window to 2/19/2020 to the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone
